analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gzhi la bar du ma bcad par spyad par mi bya'o zhes bka' stsal pa gang lags pa /

original: btsun pa dge slong gi bar du ma bcad par spyad par ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gi bar du ma bcad par spyad par ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba lta mchis lags sam /
translated: Reverend Lord, is there a case where a monk’s use of property is not a downfall?”

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /🔽'di ltar khyim bdag gis gding ba'i gding ba'am /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de / 'di ltar khyim bdag gis gding ba'i gding ba'am /
translated: “Upāli, there is.”🔽“Reverend Lord, what is it?”

original: bgo ba bar chad ma byas par spyad par dge 'dun la phul ba yin na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bgo ba bar chad ma byas par spyad par dge 'dun la phul ba yin na'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “Upāli, if a householder gives a rug or a blanket to the saṅgha without having cleared it first, there is no downfall for using it.”

original: 'dul ba dri ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa le'u gsum pa'i gtan la dbab pa'o /
analyzed: 'dul ba dri ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa le'u gsum pa'i gtan la dbab pa'o /
translated: This concludes the section on the third chapter, the chapter on questions on the vinaya.

original: // / ltung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ltung ba rnam par rig byed yin nam /
analyzed: // / ltung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ltung ba rnam par rig byed yin nam /
translated: “Downfall” and so on. Is a downfall an intimation?

original: ci zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa myur du kho bo la don ji lta ba bzhin du smros shig ces bya bar dri ba re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa myur du kho bo la don ji lta ba bzhin du smros shig ces bya bar dri ba re re la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: What? and so on. Speak to me quickly the meaning as it is.

original: rnam par rig byed ni gzhan dag la go bar byed /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ni gzhan dag la go bar byed /
translated: Indicative form is that which causes others to understand.🔽

original: khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is informative because it causes others to understand and to take it up.

original: gzhan dag la bdag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba la 'jug pa dag gis kun nas bslang ngo zhes bya bar go bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag la bdag ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba la 'jug pa dag gis kun nas bslang ngo zhes bya bar go bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It causes others to understand that one is engaged in virtuous, nonvirtuous, or neutral minds and mental factors.

original: ci zhig ces bya ba ni 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: ci zhig ces bya ba ni 'dri ba'o //
translated: What is it?

original: gzugs can ni 'di la gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽bstan mod ces bya ba ni 'di na'o //
analyzed: gzugs can ni 'di la gzugs yod pa'i phyir ro // bstan mod ces bya ba ni 'di na'o //
translated: It is form because it has form.

original: che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: che ge mo zhig na'o zhes bstan par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is demonstrable because it can be demonstrated here or there.

original: thogs dang bcas pa ni sgrib pa thogs pas rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gags byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thogs dang bcas pa ni sgrib pa thogs pas rang gi yul du gzhan 'byung ba'i gags byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is obstructive because it obstructs the arising of other forms in its own place.

original: zag bcas ni zag pa yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dus byas ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: zag bcas ni zag pa yod pa'i phyir ro // 'dus byas ni rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas pa'i phyir ram /
translated: It is contaminated because it is associated with contaminants.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is conditioned because it is created by causes and conditions, or because it possesses the characteristics of the conditioned.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni 'dri ba'o //
translated: “Or” is a question.

original: ci zhes bya ba ni yang 'dri ba nyid do //
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba ni yang 'dri ba nyid do //
translated: “What” is another question.

original: 'jig @114b rten pa ni 'khor ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽phung por ldan pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba spungs pa'i mtshan nyid phung po dag gi khongs su gtogs pa ste phung por gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig @114b rten pa ni 'khor ba'i khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro // phung por ldan pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba spungs pa'i mtshan nyid phung po dag gi khongs su gtogs pa ste phung por gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Mundane” means included in saṃsāra.🔽“Endowed with the aggregates” means included in the aggregates, which have the characteristic of a heap, such as form, feeling, conception, volitional factors, and consciousness. The meaning is “endowed with the aggregates.”

original: khams dang ldan pa ni yul dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bco brgyad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis khams rnams kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir te khams dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khams dang ldan pa ni yul dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bco brgyad kyi ngo bo nyid kyis khams rnams kyi khongs su gtogs pa'i phyir te khams dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Endowed with the elements” means included in the elements, which have the nature of the eighteen elements, such as the eye, form, and visual consciousness. The meaning is “endowed with the elements.”

original: skye mched dang ldan pa ni yul dang dbang po dang / yid dang / chos zhes bya ba sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba'i sgor gyur pa'i skye mched dag gi nang du chud pa'i phyir te skye mched du gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skye mched dang ldan pa ni yul dang dbang po dang / yid dang / chos zhes bya ba sems dang sems las byung ba skye ba'i sgor gyur pa'i skye mched dag gi nang du chud pa'i phyir te skye mched du gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Endowed with sense bases means that they are included among the sense bases that are the doors for the production of mind and mental factors called mind, mental factors and phenomena because they are included among the sense bases.

original: zin pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi gnas kyi ngo bor nye bar bzung ba ste phan pa dang gnod pa dag gis phan tshun rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽lung bstan zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: zin pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi gnas kyi ngo bor nye bar bzung ba ste phan pa dang gnod pa dag gis phan tshun rjes su byed pa'i phyir ro // lung bstan zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Grasped means that they are held as the basis of mind and mental factors because they are mutually affected by benefit and harm.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bor lung du bstan pa'i phyir bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i ngo bor lung du bstan pa'i phyir bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Indicated means that they are called indicated because they are indicated as having the nature of virtue or nonvirtue because they are the results of pleasant states.

original: 'byung ba ni sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The elements are the characteristics of earth, water, fire and wind.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba'o //
translated: Just so means that they are included.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni 'byung ba dag la yod pa'i phyir te 'byung ba la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni 'byung ba dag la yod pa'i phyir te 'byung ba la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The derived means that which exists in the elements, i.e., that which is based on the elements.

original: de ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i phyogs gcig dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i phyogs gcig dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It is the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, form, sound, odor, taste, and the tangible.

original: kun sbyor ni 'ching ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun sbyor ni 'ching ba'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fetters are of the nature of bondage.

original: bsgribs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dri mas khebs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgribs pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dri mas khebs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The obscured are covered by the stain of the afflictions.

original: 'am zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The word “or” indicates an alternative.

original: 'og ma dag la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'og ma dag la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to the following.

original: nyon mongs can ni mi dge ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs can ni mi dge ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The afflicted are unwholesome.

original: zang zing dang bcas pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa kun du spyod na des mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po thob par ro myang ba'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zang zing dang bcas pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa kun du spyod na des mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po thob par ro myang ba'i bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The substantial are those in which the activity of relishing the attainment of a desired thing exists when there is the practice of the afflictions such as passion.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: Or is it?

original: zhen pa rten pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhen pa rten pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “attachment” is used because it is associated with the sense objects.

original: 'thab bcas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni bdag dang gzhan la gnod par byed pa'i bdag nyid @115a * //
analyzed: 'thab bcas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni bdag dang gzhan la gnod par byed pa'i bdag nyid @115a * //
translated: It is “contentious” because the afflictions of desire, etc., are by nature harmful to oneself and others.

original: kyi phyir 'thab pa zhes bya ste de dang der lhan cig 'brel par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyi phyir 'thab pa zhes bya ste de dang der lhan cig 'brel par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called “contentious” because they are engaged in association with this or that.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa ni yul 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa ni yul 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is “with an object” because it grasps an object.

original: sems ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo ste /🔽dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: sems ni rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo ste / dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa la sogs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The mind is the nature of consciousness.🔽It is “accumulated” because it is accumulated by virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate dharmas,

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyis bstsags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams kyis bstsags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because it is accumulated by the dharmas of virtue, nonvirtue, and indeterminates.

original: las bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the nature of that which is to be done.

original: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'on te zhes bya ba dang bcas te dri ba'i don yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'on te zhes bya ba dang bcas te dri ba'i don yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The term “or” should be understood as having the sense of “if” or “is it?”

original: rnam smin bcas pa ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang yid du 'ong ba ma yin pa'i phyir te rnam par smin pa yod pas so ;
analyzed: rnam smin bcas pa ni 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang yid du 'ong ba ma yin pa'i phyir te rnam par smin pa yod pas so ;
translated: because it is the result of karma that is both pleasant and unpleasant, since it is the maturation of karma.

original: / de las gzhan pa ni bshad pa las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: / de las gzhan pa ni bshad pa las bzlog pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the other.

original: de bas na thams cad la so so'i dri ba 'di sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na thams cad la so so'i dri ba 'di sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, this question should be asked of all of them:

analyzed: des na de las gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgras ltung ba ci zhig rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhig gam / gzugs can ma yin pa zhig gam /
translated: What is the offense that is referred to by the term “other than that”?🔽Is it nonindicative form?

original: bstan du med pa zhig gam /🔽thogs pa med pa zhig gam /🔽zag pa med pa zhig gam /
analyzed: bstan du med pa zhig gam / thogs pa med pa zhig gam / zag pa med pa zhig gam /
translated: Is it formless?🔽Is it invisible?🔽Is it unimpeded?🔽Is it uncontaminated?

original: 'dus ma byas pa zhig gam /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa zhig gam /
translated: Is it unconditioned?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhig gam /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhig gam /
translated: Is it supramundane?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang mi ldan pa zhig gam /🔽ma zin pa zhig gam /
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang mi ldan pa zhig gam / ma zin pa zhig gam /
translated: Is it not associated with the aggregates, elements, or bases?🔽Is it not appropriated?

original: lung du ma bstan pa zhig gam /🔽kun du sbyor ba ma yin pa zhig gam /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa zhig gam / kun du sbyor ba ma yin pa zhig gam /
translated: Is it neutral?🔽Is it not a fetter?

original: ma bsgribs pa zhig gam /
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa zhig gam /
translated: Is it unobscured?

original: nyon mongs pa ma yin pa zhig gam /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma yin pa zhig gam /
translated: Is it not an affliction?

original: zang zing med pa zhig gam /
analyzed: zang zing med pa zhig gam /
translated: It is not material.

original: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa zhig gam /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la brten pa zhig gam /
translated: It is based on renunciation.

original: 'thab pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa zhig gam /
analyzed: 'thab pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa zhig gam /
translated: It is not associated with conflict.

original: dmigs pa med pa zhig gam /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa zhig gam /
translated: It is not an object.

original: sems ma yin pa zhig pa zhig gam /
analyzed: sems ma yin pa zhig pa zhig gam /
translated: It is not the mind.

original: las ma yin pa zhig gam /
analyzed: las ma yin pa zhig gam /
translated: It is not action.

original: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zhig ces bya ba de rnams go rims bzhin du 'phags par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa zhig ces bya ba de rnams go rims bzhin du 'phags par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is not a ripened result.

original: 'das pa ni 'das pa'i dus su bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: 'das pa ni 'das pa'i dus su bsdus pa ste /
translated: The past is included in the past time.

original: byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called “that which has been done.”

original: 'am zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: The word “or” indicates a question.

original: ma 'ongs pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus su bsdus pa ste /
translated: The future is included in the future time.

original: byed pa ma thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byed pa ma thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called “that which has not yet been done.”🔽The present is included in the present time.

analyzed: da ltar ni da ltar gyi dus su bsdus pa ste byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is called “that which is being done.”

original: yin zhes bya ba ni yin pa'o //
analyzed: yin zhes bya ba ni yin pa'o //
translated: The word “is” means “exists.”

original: dge ba ni rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba ni rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The wholesome is that which has a pleasant ripening.

original: de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni rjes bsnyags te des na ci zhig mi dge ba'am zhes bya ba'i tha tshig tu @115b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan zhes bya ba ni rjes bsnyags te des na ci zhig mi dge ba'am zhes bya ba'i tha tshig tu @115b 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase or otherwise is a continuation of the previous discussion. Thus, the phrase or otherwise means or unwholesome.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i dri ba ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i dri ba ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The question regarding indeterminate states has already been explained.

analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The phrase one who is endowed with the desire realm means one who is endowed with the desire realm.

analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pas bdag gir byas pa zhes bya ba'i don to // de bzhin du /
translated: This means that one who is possessed by craving that pertains to the desire realm.

analyzed: gzugs khams ldan zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Similarly, the phrase one who is endowed with the form realm means one who is endowed with the form realm.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i sred pas bdag gir byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i sred pas bdag gir byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that one who is possessed by craving that pertains to the form realm.

analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gzugs med pa'i khams dang ldan pa'am zhes bya ba brjod de /
translated: The word or indicates that one who is endowed with the formless realm is also being discussed.

analyzed: des na ci zhig gzugs dang ldan pa zhig yin nam zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the phrase or otherwise means or one who is endowed with form.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams dang ldan pa ste /
translated: One who is endowed with the formless realm is also being discussed.

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sred pas bdag gir byas ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sred pas bdag gir byas ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that they are appropriated by craving for the formless realm.

original: slob pa ni 'phags pa'i gang zag bdun gyi rgyud la skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob pa ni 'phags pa'i gang zag bdun gyi rgyud la skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called learner because they arise in the mindstreams of the seven noble beings.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //

original: mi slob pa ni dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi slob pa ni dgra bcom pa'i rgyud la skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called nonlearner because they arise in the mindstream of an arhat.

original: de gnyis spangs pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i mtshan nyid rnam gnyis dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de gnyis spangs pa ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i mtshan nyid rnam gnyis dang bral ba ste /
translated: They are free from both because they are free from the two characteristics of learner and nonlearner.

analyzed: ci zhig slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa zhig gam snyam du bsams pa bzhin no //

analyzed: bsgom pas spang bya zhes bya ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya na zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: bsgom pa ni goms pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni goms pa'o //

analyzed: des na gang zhig 'phags pa'i lam yang dang yang du bsgom pas spang bar bya ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore they are called objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation because they are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that is familiarization.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: But is it not so?

original: mthong bas zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyeg go //
analyzed: mthong bas zhes bya ba ni spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i rjes bsnyeg go //
translated: “By seeing” is to be supplied from the previous line.

analyzed: mngon par bsams zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: srog gcod ces bya ba ni srog gcod pas kun nas bslang ba ste /

analyzed: thams cad du kha na ma tho ba chen po gang yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra yang thams cad du bsdu ba yin te /
analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra yang thams cad du bsdu ba yin te /
translated: The word “and” is inclusive in all cases.

original: gsal bar bdag la smra bar gyis shig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsal bar bdag la smra bar gyis shig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It means “speak clearly to me.”🔽Here, the meaning is this: By what cause are all downfalls taught and likewise subsumed?

original: 'di la don ni rgyu gang gis ltung ba thams cad kyi bstan pa dang de bzhin du bsdu ba rnam par gzhag / ngag gis kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba kha na ma tho ba chen po ni gang yin /
analyzed: 'di la don ni rgyu gang gis ltung ba thams cad kyi bstan pa dang de bzhin du bsdu ba rnam par gzhag / ngag gis kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba kha na ma tho ba chen po ni gang yin /
translated: What is the great offense that is motivated by speech?

original: de bzhin du lus kyis kun nas bslang pa'i nang nas kha na ma tho ba chen po ni gang yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyis kun nas bslang pa'i nang nas kha na ma tho ba chen po ni gang yin /
translated: Likewise, from among those motivated by body, what is the greatest offense?

original: phra mas kun nas bslang ba dang / gang zag gis kun nas bslang ba dang / dge 'dun gyis kun nas bslang ba dang / srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra bas kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa skyed par byed pa ni gang yin pa dris /
analyzed: phra mas kun nas bslang ba dang / gang zag gis kun nas bslang ba dang / dge 'dun gyis kun nas bslang ba dang / srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / mi tshangs par spyod pa dang / brdzun du smra bas kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa skyed par byed pa ni gang yin pa dris /
translated: What is the offense motivated by slander, by a person, by the Saṅgha, by killing, by stealing, by impure conduct, or by lying that generates immeasurable suffering?

original: de rim pa gsal ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de rim pa gsal ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: You should explain this in stages, just as it is.🔽This is the topic.

original: 'di la gtan la dbab pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la gtan la dbab pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The conclusion is this:

original: bstan pa ni sdom pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni sdom pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The teaching is non-vow.

original: bsdu ba yang sdom pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba yang sdom pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The summary is also non-vow.

original: ngag gis kun nas bslang ba la ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mi snyan par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gis kun nas bslang ba la ni de bzhin gshegs pa la mi snyan par brjod pa'o //
translated: As for those motivated by speech, it is speaking unpleasantly to the Tathāgata.

original: lus kyis kun nas bslang ba la ni ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis kun nas bslang ba la ni ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa'o //
translated: The one motivated by body is the shedding of blood with evil intent.

original: phra mas kun nas bslang ba la ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen no //
analyzed: phra mas kun nas bslang ba la ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen no //
translated: The one motivated by slander is the schism of the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun gyis kun nas bslang ba la ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen nyid de //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis kun nas bslang ba la ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen nyid de //
translated: The one motivated by the Saṅgha is the schism of the Saṅgha.

original: gang zag gis kun nas bslang ba la ni yang dag pa ma yin par skur ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag gis kun nas bslang ba la ni yang dag pa ma yin par skur ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: The one motivated by the person is false praise.

original: srog gcod pas kun nas bslang ba la ni rang sangs rgyas gsod pa'o //🔽ma byin par len pas kun nas bslang ba la ni dge 'dun gyi 'du ba'i sgo 'phrog @130a * //
analyzed: srog gcod pas kun nas bslang ba la ni rang sangs rgyas gsod pa'o // ma byin par len pas kun nas bslang ba la ni dge 'dun gyi 'du ba'i sgo 'phrog @130a * //
translated: The one motivated by killing is the killing of a pratyekabuddha.🔽The one motivated by stealing is the stealing of the Saṅgha’s means of gathering.

original: pa'o ; / mi tshangs par spyod pas kun nas bslang ba la ni dgra bcom ma mi tshangs par spyod pas sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / mi tshangs par spyod pas kun nas bslang ba la ni dgra bcom ma mi tshangs par spyod pas sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: The one motivated by sexual misconduct is the defiling of an arhat nun through sexual misconduct.

original: brdzun du smra bas kun nas bslang ba la ni phra ma smra ba'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smra bas kun nas bslang ba la ni phra ma smra ba'o //
translated: The one motivated by lying is the speaking of slander.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung gi don go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung gi don go rims bzhin te /
translated: Similarly, here the meaning of the text is in order.

original: dge slong dag rgyu gcig gis ltung ba thams cad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag rgyu gcig gis ltung ba thams cad bstan pa yin te /
translated: Monks, all downfalls are taught by one cause,

original: 'di lta ste sdom pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sdom pa ma yin pas so //
translated: namely, by non-restraint.

original: 'di la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning here is this:

original: sdom pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni mi ldog pa'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni mi ldog pa'i bsam pa ste /
translated: Non-restraint is the intention not to desist.

original: mi ldog pa'i bsam pa can la ni bshags pa la sogs pa'i sgrub pa yod du zin kyang ltung ba yod do zhes bya bar bstan cing tha snyad gdags pa 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi ldog pa'i bsam pa can la ni bshags pa la sogs pa'i sgrub pa yod du zin kyang ltung ba yod do zhes bya bar bstan cing tha snyad gdags pa 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Even if one who has the intention not to desist has the practice of confession, etc., it is said that he has a downfall, and the designation “one who has a downfall” applies to him.

original: mdo byed pas kyang gzhan la ni de dang bcas pa'i bshags pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo byed pas kyang gzhan la ni de dang bcas pa'i bshags pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The author of the Abhidharmakośa also explains that confession is accompanied by that non-restraint.

original: rgyu gcig gis ltung ba thams cad bsdus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu gcig gis ltung ba thams cad bsdus par 'gyur te /
translated: All downfalls are included by one cause,

original: 'di lta ste sdom pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sdom pa ma yin pas so //
translated: namely, by non-restraint.

original: 'di la yang don ni de kho nar zad do //
analyzed: 'di la yang don ni de kho nar zad do //
translated: The meaning here is just that.

original: ngag gis kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la yang dag pa ma yin pas mi snyan par brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gis kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la yang dag pa ma yin pas mi snyan par brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The most reprehensible of all verbal transgressions is to speak falsely and unpleasantly to a tathagata.

original: lus kyis kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa gang yin pa'o //🔽phra mas kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dbye bar rtsom pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin pa gang yin pa'o // phra mas kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dbye bar rtsom pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The most reprehensible of all physical transgressions is to draw blood from a tathagata with evil intent.🔽The most reprehensible of all transgressions motivated by slander is to attempt to divide the saṅgha of disciples of the tathagata.

original: dge 'dun gyis kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni 'di lta ste dge 'dun gyi dbyen no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni 'di lta ste dge 'dun gyi dbyen no //
translated: The most reprehensible of all transgressions motivated by the saṅgha is to create a schism in the saṅgha.

original: gang zag gis kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni /
analyzed: gang zag gis kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni /
translated: The most reprehensible of all downfalls motivated by a person is

analyzed: 'di lta ste yang dag pa ma yin pas skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: to slander the true Dharma.🔽The most reprehensible of all downfalls motivated by killing is

original: srog gcod pas kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni rang sangs rgyas gsod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pas kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni rang sangs rgyas gsod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: to kill a solitary sage.🔽The most reprehensible of all downfalls motivated by stealing is

original: ma byin par len pas kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi 'du ba'i sgo 'phrog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pas kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun gyi 'du ba'i sgo 'phrog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: to steal the property of the Saṅgha of the Tathāgata’s disciples.🔽The most reprehensible of all downfalls motivated by sexual misconduct is

original: mi tshangs par spyod pas @130b kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni ma dgra bcom pa sun 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pas @130b kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas kha na ma tho ba che ba ni ma dgra bcom pa sun 'byin pa'o //
translated: to corrupt a nun who is an arhat.

original: brdzun du smra bas kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas sdig pa che ba ni mi'i chos bla ma byed cing mi bdog bzhin du brjod pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: brdzun du smra bas kun nas bslang ba'i ltung ba gcig kun gyi nang nas sdig pa che ba ni mi'i chos bla ma byed cing mi bdog bzhin du brjod pa'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The most sinful of all downfalls is to claim to be a spiritual teacher while not being one.

analyzed: 'di ltar mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis dri ba gcig kho na zhig bsham pa'i rim pas dri bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to ask a single question by the method of summarizing,

analyzed: mang du smra yang ci zhig dgos // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / mang du smra zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i tshul lam /
translated: what is the use of speaking much?

original: 'dul bar gtogs pa ma bshad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul bar gtogs pa ma bshad pa'o //
translated: Speaking much is the method just explained or what is not explained in the Vinaya.

original: ci zhig dgos zhes bya ba ni cir yang mi dgos pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci zhig dgos zhes bya ba ni cir yang mi dgos pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the use? It is not useful at all.

original: mdor sdus shig ces bya ba ni spros pa dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: mdor sdus shig ces bya ba ni spros pa dang bral ba ste /
translated: Summarize it! means free from elaboration.

original: gang gi phyir dri ba zab mo rnams ha cang zab mo byas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dri ba zab mo rnams ha cang zab mo byas na /
translated: Because if profound questions are made too profound,

original: yun ring po zhig tu nyon mongs pa dang / khyod kho po la ma rangs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir ;
analyzed: yun ring po zhig tu nyon mongs pa dang / khyod kho po la ma rangs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir ;
translated: For a long time you have been afflicted by the afflictions and have been displeased with yourself.

analyzed: kho bos khyod la mdor bsdus pa'i tshig gcig kho na cig smra'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, I will speak to you just one brief word.

analyzed: khro spangs zhes bya ba ni mi dga' ba yongs su btang ste'o //
translated: Having abandoned anger means having given up displeasure.

original: mdza' bar gyur byas nas zhes bya ba ni bshes su byas nas te /
analyzed: mdza' bar gyur byas nas zhes bya ba ni bshes su byas nas te /
translated: Having become friendly means having become intimate.

analyzed: khro spangs phan par 'dod pas g-yo dang sgyu med pas khyod la smra'i brnyas par 'dod pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having abandoned anger, I speak to you with the desire to benefit, without deceit or fraud, not with the desire to belittle.

original: sdom pa kun la brtan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdom pa kun la brtan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Firm in all vows means

original: dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / dge sbyong dang / dge sbyong ma dang / bsnyen gnas la gnas pa dag la'o //
analyzed: dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / dge sbyong dang / dge sbyong ma dang / bsnyen gnas la gnas pa dag la'o //
translated: in the vows of the upāsaka, upāsikā, śramaṇa, śramaṇerī, and upavāsastha.

original: kun mkhyen gyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pas so //
analyzed: kun mkhyen gyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pas so //
translated: The omniscient one means the one who knows all.

original: skyabs zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: skyabs zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ste /
translated: Refuge means going for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: 'dir ngan song dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'jigs par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'dir ngan song dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'jigs par 'gyur bas so //
translated: Here, one should fear the suffering of the lower rebirths, such as the hells.

original: dge slong nyid las zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi sdom pa la'o //
analyzed: dge slong nyid las zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi sdom pa la'o //
translated: From the state of a fully ordained monk means from the vow of a fully ordained monk.

original: gsal bar zhes bya ba ni sal sal por kho bo la smros shig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gsal bar zhes bya ba ni sal sal por kho bo la smros shig ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Clearly means speak clearly to me.

translated: Here, there are many other profound questions belonging to the Vinaya, and if I ask you about them, you will be troubled for a long time.🔽Therefore, first, by shaking hands, I want to help you with a brief question.

original: gi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa'i dus na ni /
analyzed: gi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa'i dus na ni /
translated: Therefore, at the time of taking the vow of a fully ordained monk,

original: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ma gsungs la /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba ma gsungs la /
translated: going for refuge to the Three Jewels is not mentioned.

analyzed: skyabs su ma song ba la min zhes 'byung bas gzhan dag la ni gsungs zhes bya ba'i dri ba gcig cig dris te /
translated: Since it is said that it is not for those who have not gone for refuge, it is said for others.

analyzed: kho bo la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du smros shig ces bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Speak to me truthfully!

original: 'di la gtan la dbab pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la gtan la dbab pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The conclusion is as follows:

analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhes smos pas skyabs su 'gro ba grub pa'i dbang du mdzad nas de skad du gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Since the term fully ordained is mentioned, this is stated from the perspective of one who has already taken refuge.

original: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Similarly, the text here is:

analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis bdag bsnyen par rdzogs par bya bar mdzad du gsol /
translated: Venerable Saṅgha, please grant me full ordination.

original: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis bdag rjes su gzung du gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun btsun pa rnams kyis bdag rjes su gzung du gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Venerable Saṅgha, please accept me.

analyzed: de bzhin du 'grel pa byed pas bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bya ba'i sgra khong nas de'i don 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: And so on. Similarly, the commentator says that the term fully ordained is implied in the meaning.

analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa thams cad las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is characterized by turning away from all that should not be done.

analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa khas len pa ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa ste /
translated: Accepting nirvāṇa with one's entire being is full ordination.

analyzed: 'di ltar bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa la khang bsnyen te rnam par gnas pa yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Similarly, it is said:

analyzed: de bzhin du yang nga'i nyan thos tshul khrims ldan pa de la mtho ris ni ras yug gis bar du chod pa tsam mo //

analyzed: thar pa ni yol bas chod pa tsam mo zhes gsungs so //
translated: Liberation is as close as the other side of a curtain.”🔽And:🔽“Praise, acquisition of wealth,🔽and the joy of heaven

original: yang / rab tu bsngags dang nor rnyed dang // pha rol mtho ris dga' ba yis //🔽bde ba gsungs don gnyer byed pa //
analyzed: yang / rab tu bsngags dang nor rnyed dang // pha rol mtho ris dga' ba yis // bde ba gsungs don gnyer byed pa //
translated: are the three benefits🔽that the wise person seeks by relying on moral discipline.

original: blo dang ldan pas tshul khrims bsten //
analyzed: blo dang ldan pas tshul khrims bsten //
translated: The wise person relies on moral discipline

original: gnas gsum de dag legs mthong ba'i //🔽mkhas pas tshul khrims bsten par bya //
analyzed: gnas gsum de dag legs mthong ba'i // mkhas pas tshul khrims bsten par bya //
translated: in order to see well these three benefits.

original: 'phags pa'i mthong ba'i phun tshogs te //🔽'jig rten na ni zhi pa bsten //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i mthong ba'i phun tshogs te // 'jig rten na ni zhi pa bsten //
translated: The perfection of seeing the noble ones🔽is the peace that is relied on in the world.”

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: And:🔽“The wise person relies on moral discipline🔽in order to see well these three benefits.

analyzed: de ltar rnam pa sna tshogs mang po brjod pas gzhan spobs pa med par byas nas mjug bsdu ba dang / de ltas 'dul ba rgya mtsho las //
translated: Thus, having made others speechless by speaking in many various ways, he concludes:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, from the ocean of Vinaya,🔽I have extracted a little bit.

original: de ltas zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: de ltas zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: Therefore means as just explained.
